intro: Achillea gypsicola, commonly known as the gypsum yarrow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and flat, composite flower heads that range from white to pale yellow. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
